org.gradoop.storage.hbase.impl.handler

Class HBaseElementHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.storage.hbase.impl.handler.HBaseElementHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, ElementHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HBaseGraphElementHandler, HBaseGraphHeadHandler

    public abstract class HBaseElementHandler
extends Object
implements ElementHandler
    Handler is used to write label and properties into HBase tables. This is used by graphs and vertices.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isPreSplitRegions

        public boolean isPreSplitRegions()
        Description copied from interface: ElementHandler
        Indicates whether the regions in HBase tables are pre-split or not.
        Specified by:
        isPreSplitRegions in interface ElementHandler
        Returns:
        true, if a pre-split of regions is used

      • setPreSplitRegions

        public void setPreSplitRegions(boolean usePreSplitRegions)
        Description copied from interface: ElementHandler
        Enable/Disable the usage of pre-splitting regions at the moment of table creation. If the HBase table size grows, it should be created with pre-split regions in order to avoid region hotspots. If certain region servers are stressed by very intensive write/read operations, HBase may drop that region server because the Zookeeper connection will timeout. Note that this flag has no effect if the tables already exist.
        Specified by:
        setPreSplitRegions in interface ElementHandler
        Parameters:
        usePreSplitRegions - flag to decide if the pre-split of regions should be used

      • isSpreadingByteUsed

        public boolean isSpreadingByteUsed()
        Description copied from interface: ElementHandler
        Indicates whether the row key is salted with a spreading byte as prefix or not.
        Specified by:
        isSpreadingByteUsed in interface ElementHandler
        Returns:
        true, if a spreading byte is used as row key prefix

      • setSpreadingByteUsage

        public void setSpreadingByteUsage(boolean useSpreadingByte)
        Description copied from interface: ElementHandler
        Enable/Disable the usage of a spreading byte as prefix of each HBase row key. This affects reading and writing from/to HBase. Records in HBase are sorted lexicographically by the row key. This allows fast access to an individual record by its key and fast fetching of a range of data given start and stop keys. But writing records with such naive keys will cause hotspotting because of how HBase writes data to its Regions. With this option you can disable this hotspotting.
        Specified by:
        setSpreadingByteUsage in interface ElementHandler
        Parameters:
        useSpreadingByte - flag to decide if the spreading byte should be used

      • getPossibleRowKeys
